text: sima and I'm back with a new lesson on
slams well what are slangs slangs are
nothing but expressions used in English
in an informal way and it is mostly used
in speaking rather than in writing slams
are very interesting because you can use
them in your everyday speech well let's
have a look at a few of them and see how
you can use it when you speak to people
every day
the first Lac I've got for you is
donkey's years
well what is donkey's years mean
donkey's years means nothing but for
ages or for a very very very long period
of time so if I haven't met someone for
a very long period of time I can say
that I haven't seen that person for
donkey's years or you could say I
haven't met up with my cousin's for
donkey's years
this next line above you is quite
interesting it is full monty now the
expression or the slang full monty means
two different things
the first meaning of full monty is to do
the whole thing or go the whole way it
basically means that doing something in
a wholesome way in its complete entirety
so I could say something like I had eggs
bacon baked beans sausages the full
monty for breakfast which means I had a
really wholesome breakfast I went the
whole way to make sure I
really well for breakfast now the other
meaning of full monty means to
completely strip yourself of every
clothing you are wearing which means you
are going stark naked so I can say
something like that the 18 year old boy
did a full monty at the party last night
that's another winning for a full monty
but depending on what context you are
using the slang in you've got to use it
accordingly
and my next expression is hunky-dory
well what is hunky-dory mean hunky-dory
means excellent it means that everything
is going just perfect just according to
plan no worries everything is in
complete order so it's almost like a bed
of roses I can use a sentence like their
relationship is just two months old and
therefore everything is hunky-dory
meaning that they don't really have some
tough challenges everything is just
going really well for it and my next
slang is picky well what is a hickey
hickey is nothing but what most of you
call a love bite which is mostly a
bruise like mark or an impression that
is left around areas near your neck your
arm it is mainly caused by the kissing
or the sucking of that particular area
on your skin done mostly by the partner
that you are intimate with and it does
take around 5 to 12 days for that mark
to go away
well my friend she had a hickey or a
love bite after her very first date so
if you want to talk about a hickey or a
love bite you will refer to that
mark that's going to be in your skin
after your date or after you get kind of
intimate with your partner
my next slang is the world pat's well we
all wear pants
but what is the word or slang pants mean
when I use it in an informal way of
speaking the word pants is nothing but
something that I refer to as total crap
total rubbish something that is absolute
nonsense well I could say something like
the man who sang in the show Britain's
Got Talent was total pants you know what
he sang was rubbish it didn't make any
sense at all
so total pants is nothing but something
that you categorize as being real real
crap the next line of God for you is the
expression swatting what is the
expression swatting mean swatting means
nothing but starting really hard or
stunning at the last minute just before
your exams or before that test that you
are about to take a week from now I
could say something like you better get
swatting if you want to pass that test I
am guilty of swatting because I don't
really study throughout the year but I
swat just two days before the exams
well my next slang or the next
expression I've got for you is taking
the piss what does it mean to take the
piss taking the piss is nothing but
making fun of someone now a lot of you
in schools and in colleges you have the
habit of making fun of people so what
you're really doing is you are taking
the piss at them so I could say
something like listen stop taking the
piss add John he's a completely innocent
person so all you've got to do is
stop taking the piss at people who
really are harmless and my next slang
for the day is lost the plot well what
does it mean to lose one's plot it means
that you are going crazy or you are
quite mentally unstable you're kind of
empty out there so you know some people
they kind of do weird things they yell
they scream they go completely berserk
so when you see someone like that you
can say what have you lost the plot or
you can say that you really lost the
plot you're acting kind of weird today
so that's what losing the plot means our
next slang is it's monkeys outside well
this slang does not refer to literal
monkeys but it refers to an expression
which tells me that it's really freezing
outside it's really cold outside so I
can tell my friend who is going out in
the freezing cold something like don't
forget your jacket
it's monkeys outside well I don't know
which part of the world you are in but
if it's monkeys outside you might want
to wear something really more alright my
next expression and the last expression
of this lesson is the slang knock out
well what is the word knock out mean the
word no car is nothing but telling
someone that they look beautiful they
look stunning
or maybe just drop-dead gorgeous well I
could say something like my friend
looked a complete knockout last night at
the party well if you want head turning
your way you might want to appear a
knockout the next time
you go for that party well that's it
